Professional Experience

Data Analyst                                                                               
 
August 2015 – till date
Company: Incubit GBS, Noida, UP
Working as Data Analyst on the below listed American Express projects:

Client: American Express 
Project: AMEX Hierarchy Management (Team size 12)
AMEX Hierarchy Management Project is about managing the Affiliation and Disaffiliation of the Parent and the child merchant companies under a certain ranking pyramid. Work responsibilities include running relational analytics for the list of merchants provided by AMEX to find co-relation between Name, Brand, Phones no.s and Geographies. Post relational analytics, run ranking algorithms and process the filtered data through defined business rules. Finally take approval from client and publish the data as per the AMEX Hierarchy Management System. 
Technology used: SQL Server and MS Excel
Responsibilities: 

· Liaison with client on regular basis to understand the project requirements and keep a track of changes in business strategies for system operations. Create Business Requirement Document (BRDs) and provide work projection matrix.
· Perform analysis on clients data and create functional requirements and explain it to developers.

· Create Work Break-down Structure (WBS), create tasks and assign it to various responsible teams.
· Setting up daily stand up meetings with team to discuss work status and accordingly assignment of resources to balance work load.
· Developing/updating and maintaining SQL Server tables, stored procedure, triggers in scripts used for extensive reporting in support of client.

· Responsible for unit testing the program for checking correct data and ensure that the correct methodology and standards have been followed.

· Responsible for creating the reports using SQL Server Database and ensuring the results are accurate for confirmation from client for transforming data into information.

· Peer reviewing the configuration, analysis and reporting done by the team members and suggest improvements in the program performance if needed along with documentation and versioning for change logs.
· Responsible for mentoring and training new joiners in the team including domain, functional, technical as well as process knowledge sharing.
· Leading the look-back meetings post project completion to discuss effective strategies to continuously improve project deliveries.
· Maintain the project plan for a stage of the process and keeping all the related artifacts.
Project: Monthly/Bi-Weekly ETL (Team size 4)
AMEX data is extensive and is constantly changing. In order to get latest data for Incubit’s ongoing processes, we perform monthly and bi-weekly data load using ETL environment made with SQL and XML scripts.
Technology used: SQL Server, SAS Enterprise Guide, XML and MS Excel
Responsibilities: 

· Analysis of current data and generating its backup.

· Extract raw data from AMEX SAS database.

· Clean/Convert raw data into readable format for SQL server scripts.

· Execute and monitor scheduled jobs and verification for correct data load.

· Ensure compliance adherence to ETL methodology and standards.
· Stakeholder communication and notification for each activity in advance for minimal performance impact during the process.
Sr. Implementation Analyst                                                                               
 April 2011 - March 2015
Company:  Mercer India Pvt. Limited, Gurgaon, Haryana 

Worked on the below listed projects while working with Mercer as Senior Implementation Analyst in Defined Benefits domain:
Clients: US Foods, AteraZeneca
Projects: HR Import (MERCER DB Conversion 3x-4x)

Developed/Updated Human Resource Import setup for BW (Benefit Workstation), A setup within

the BW by which a new implemented client imports all the information of their participants. 
Technology used: Oracle SQL Server 8i, Infomaker, Spirit

Responsibilities: 

· Understand the flow for BW 3x HR import setup and break the same into different modules to make it compatible with BW4x functionalities along with BW3x functionalities.
· Unit testing of each scenario, triggering onto Import by creating a comprehensive test plan.
· End to end testing by importing more than 1000 of dummy test cases.

· Perform DB testing and prepare unit test plans along with execution of all required scenarios.

· Supported the client on each update on the setup whenever there is any requirements.

· Kept onshore team and the upper management team into loop by maintaining the all the reports by workflow tools.
Clients: AteraZeneca, Solutia, USFood, Bimbo Bakery, CBS
Project: DJ (Data Junction) Jobs update (MERCER DB Conversion 3x-4x)
DJ is an ETL (Extract transform and load) tool on which BW3x specific jobs are converted into BW4x specific jobs. Additional 4x environment flags are added upon SQL and VB scripts to be used in each jobs so that it works in accordance with 4x environment standards.
Technology used: Data Junction map designer, Infomaker, DJ Scheduler.  
Responsibilities: 

· Conversion of each jobs and set them into the scheduler of the client.

· Unit testing of each DJ jobs with all identified scenarios. 
· Migrating a particular Test DJ job into PROD.
